descriptions.content: Ilam Bazaar was the district capital of Illam District in Eastern Nepal. In 1964-5, it contained the administrative offices of the district and about 90 permanent shops, which offered a number of basic consumer items - imported mainly from India - and services. There was also a twice-weekly market which attracted petty traders and peasant shoppers from the surrounding area.
descriptions.title: Description of Ilam Bazaar in 1964-65
